context.p: To install on a Unix / Linux server, follow these steps:

step.cmd:
Install on the server and make sure the oxygen.sh
oxygenAuthor.sh
oxygenDeveloper.sh
diffFiles.sh and diffDirs.sh
syncroSVNClient.sh script is executable and the installation directory is in the PATH of the users that need to use the editor.
If you need to run multiple instances of the , make sure you add the -Dcom.oxygenxml.MultipleInstances=true parameter in the startup script.
Make sure you allocate sufficient memory to by setting an appropriate value for the -Xmx parameter in the .sh startup script.
Make sure the X server processes located on the workstations allow connections from the server host. For this, use the xhost command.
Telnet (or ssh) on the server host.
Start an xterm process, with the display parameter set on the current workstation. For example: xterm -display workstationip:0.0.

Start by typing oxygen.sh
oxygenAuthor.sh
oxygenDeveloper.sh
diffFiles.sh or diffDirs.sh
syncroSVNClient.sh .
